pain_points.description: Difficulty in identifying new events and their posting times.
supporting_quotes: I'm like, how the heck am I supposed to know which one was posted and when did it open?
pain_points.current_workarounds: User tries to keep track of events manually or relies on vague information provided.
pain_points.impact_on_user: Frustration leads to missing out on events and confusion about available options.

pain_points.description: Inconsistent experience between the app and website.
supporting_quotes: The app works better... but they're completely separate.
pain_points.current_workarounds: User prefers to use the app for a better experience.
pain_points.impact_on_user: User may miss features available on the website, leading to a fragmented experience.

pain_points.description: Lack of upfront pricing information for events.
supporting_quotes: It'd be nice to see the price, too, before you click into it.
pain_points.current_workarounds: User clicks into events to find pricing but finds it inconvenient.
pain_points.impact_on_user: Time wasted on exploring events that may not fit their budget, leading to frustration.

pain_points.description: Confusing notification system for new events.
supporting_quotes: New events posted... we're finding that we don't know when things are posted.
There might just be some time when things are posted regularly.
pain_points.current_workarounds: User relies on a newsletter for updates but still feels unsure.
pain_points.impact_on_user: User may miss important updates and feel disconnected from new offerings.

pain_points.description: The app and website have different functionalities leading to confusion.
supporting_quotes: I think the app works better... but they're completely separate.
pain_points.current_workarounds: User sticks to the app for its perceived superiority.
pain_points.impact_on_user: Users may not utilize all features available, leading to a reduced experience.
